10.1.17  12:30 am   Images appear to move very musically in your videos. Can you elaborate on the way you make your video synchronize rhythmically with your sound? I imagine it's very hard to make the visual rhythm of the images FEEL in lockstep with the musical rhythm. I wonder how much the visual rhythm informs our experience of the audio rhythm?
10.1.17  12:24 am   How to tell Zebras apart from other striped animals like okapis, tigers, chipmunks, skunks etc.

10.1.17  12:10 am   Hi Bill! Sorry if you're tired of getting hotewig questions.. but I'd like to know more about your thought process/goals for writing the intro part. After the big bang, there's pretty much a straightforward story line for you to follow (if you can call the history of the world straightforward)... but everything from "hi, you're on a rock..." up until "i think there's a universe now" must've been really tricky to write. The origin of the universe (and history of the universe) seems like a real tough story to set the scene for. Did you find it hard to come up with a good intro for the video? (Btw I think you nailed it).
